p: Garlic ( Allium sativum L., Amaryllidaceae) likely originated in Central Asia [ 1]. The plant has been used as a flavoring agent and a traditional medicine since antiquity, and is now cultivated worldwide [ 1, 2]. Allium vineale L. (wild garlic, crow garlic) is native to Great Britain, most of Europe, North Africa, and the Middle East. The plant has been introduced to North America, Australia, and New Zealand [ 3].
